channel.title: Reuters: Technology News
channel.description: Reuters.com is your source for breaking news, business, financial and investing news, including personal finance and stocks. Reuters is the leading global provider of news, financial information and technology solutions to the world's media, financial institutions, businesses and individuals.
channel.copyright: All rights reserved. Users may download and print extracts of content from this website for their own personal and non-commercial use only. item.title: Regulators probe EV batteries after Chevy Volt fire
item.description: WASHINGTON/DETROIT (Reuters) - Regulators are investigating the safety of batteries used to power electric vehicles after a General Motors Co Volt caught fire following a crash test.

item.title: "Call of Duty" has $400 million in sales on day 1
item.description: (Reuters) - Activision Blizzard's "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3" video game racked up more than $400 million in sales on its first day in stores in the United States and the United Kingdom.

item.title: Apple releases iPhone battery drain software fix
item.description: (Reuters) - Apple Inc on Thursday released a software update for its iOS 5 operating system to fix complaints on the performance of the new iPhone 4S battery.

item.title: U.S. probes EV batteries after Chevy Volt fire
item.description: WASHINGTON/DETROIT (Reuters) - U.S. regulators are investigating the safety of batteries used to power electric vehicles after a General Motors Co Chevrolet Volt caught fire following a routine crash test.

item.title: Lenders to grill Olympus as delisting looms: source
item.description: TOKYO (Reuters) - Lenders will confront Japan's Olympus Corp next week to demand an explanation for an accounting scandal engulfing the firm, a banking source said on Friday, though he denied reports they would seek more security over their loans.

item.title: Facebook near privacy settlement with FTC: report
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Facebook is finalizing a settlement with federal regulators over changes to its privacy policies enacted two years ago, the Wall Street Journal reported.

item.title: Internet scam targets state securities regulators
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - An organization of state securities regulators, whose goal is to protect investors from fraud, says it has been the victim of an attempted Internet scam.

item.title: Olympus used inflated deposits to mask losses: Nikkei
item.description: (Reuters) - Investigations into scandal-hit Olympus Corp revealed an elaborate scheme for concealing losses on risky bets behind a facade of inflated bank deposits and securities holdings, The Nikkei reported.

item.title: Telecom Italia confirms targets as 9-month core earnings rise
item.description: MILAN (Reuters) - Telecom Italia stuck to its guidance on Friday after nine-month core earnings rose as Italy's biggest telecoms operator slightly improved its position in the fiercely competitive domestic market.

item.title: Senate defeats effort to block Internet rules
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - New U.S. Internet traffic rules cleared a hurdle on Thursday, surviving an attempt by the Senate to block them from taking effect later in the month.

item.title: Telefonica 9-month net weak as tough market bites
item.description: MADRID (Reuters) - Spanish telecoms giant Telefonica stuck doggedly to ambitious shareholder return targets on Friday even while 9-month profit fell a more-than-expected 69 percent in what the group described as a "challenging" operating environment.

item.title: Chipmaker Nvidia's quarterly results beats Street
item.description: (Reuters) - Nvidia Corp's third-quarter results beat estimates as the chipmaker refocused on smartphones and tablets in a tepid personal computer market, although its revenue forecast was a bit lower than expected.

item.title: Private equity takes two approaches to Yahoo: sources
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Private equity firms including KKR and TPG Capital are looking to potentially buy minority stakes of up to 20 percent in Yahoo Inc with an eye to eventually taking over the whole company, people with knowledge of the situation said.

item.title: WiLAN's 759 Patent validated in U.S.
item.description: (Reuters) - Canadian patent licensing firm WiLAN Inc said the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (PTO) validated most of the claims in one of its key patents, bringing a re-examination process that began in January closer to completion.

item.title: Apple releases iPhone battery drain software fix
item.description: (Reuters) - Apple Inc on Thursday released a software update for its iOS 5 operating system to fix complaints on the performance of the new iPhone 4S battery.

item.title: Telecom Italia confirms targets as 9-month core earnings rise
item.description: MILAN (Reuters) - Telecom Italia stuck to its guidance on Friday after nine-month core earnings rose as Italy's biggest telecoms operator slightly improved its position in the fiercely competitive domestic market.

item.title: Telefonica 9-month net weak as tough market bites
item.description: MADRID (Reuters) - Spanish telecoms giant Telefonica stuck doggedly to ambitious shareholder return targets on Friday even while 9-month profit fell a more-than-expected 69 percent in what the group described as a "challenging" operating environment.

item.title: Private equity takes two approaches to Yahoo: sources
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Private equity firms including KKR and TPG Capital are looking to potentially buy minority stakes of up to 20 percent in Yahoo Inc with an eye to eventually taking over the whole company, people with knowledge of the situation said.

item.title: Facebook near privacy settlement with FTC: report
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Facebook is finalizing a settlement with federal regulators over changes to its privacy policies enacted two years ago, the Wall Street Journal reported.

item.title: Apple releases iPhone battery drain software fix
item.description: (Reuters) - Apple Inc on Thursday released a software update for its iOS 5 operating system to fix complaints on the performance of the new iPhone 4S battery.

item.title: Chipmaker Nvidia's quarterly results beats Street
item.description: (Reuters) - Nvidia Corp's third-quarter results beat estimates as the chipmaker refocused on smartphones and tablets in a tepid personal computer market, although its revenue forecast was a bit lower than expected.

item.title: Olympus used inflated deposits to mask losses: Nikkei
item.description: (Reuters) - Investigations into scandal-hit Olympus Corp revealed an elaborate scheme for concealing losses on risky bets behind a facade of inflated bank deposits and securities holdings, The Nikkei reported.

item.title: Internet scam targets state securities regulators
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - An organization of state securities regulators, whose goal is to protect investors from fraud, says it has been the victim of an attempted Internet scam.

item.title: New Jersey teacher could be fired for comments on Facebook
item.description: MONTCLAIR, N.J (Reuters) - A first-grade teacher in New Jersey who described her students as "future criminals" on Facebook could be fired under a judge's decision issued this week after parents complained her remarks were offensive.

item.title: Hard drive shortage could hurt PC delivery early next year: IDC
item.description: (Reuters) - PC shipments may be crimped by as much as a fifth in the first three months of 2012, hurt by the shortage of hard disk drives (HDD) after the Thailand floods, said IDC.
